enough pie
well this peach slab pie feeds a crowd
and they'll be leftovers for breakfast
first thing you want to do is make the
crust you can do this a couple of days
ahead if you've got time and it'll sit

already you have to use enough salt when
you're making pie crusts because if you
just use flour it's just gonna taste

need to make a lot of pie crust this is
probably about double ish a normal pie
crust so you need a big food processor

either two knives or a pastry cutter so
I'm just gonna give this a quick mix
just to make sure that the salt is well

cut into cubes have you ever looked at

for chickpea lima bean sized pieces okay
this is perfect this is exactly what I'm
looking for when you're using the food
processor you have to be extra careful
about not over processing the butter at
this point because it goes so quickly
and this is how you get flaky pie crust
this is the crucial aspect of getting a
flaky pie crust as the crust bakes the
water from the butter evaporates and
causes steam and that steam pushes the
dough up and then you get a little air
pocket and that is a flake so I'm going
to add the water slowly a little bit at
a time because you never know how much
water the flour is going to absorb you
want very cold water you don't want to

the reason that I'm going to put the

it also allows the moisture to
distribute evenly after an hour so in
the fridge it'll be all nice and uniform
so here's my dough it's gonna soften
pretty quickly as you start to work it
it's a little bit softer now and now I
